HarperCollins KissCon

overview

If books are the heart of publishing, marketing is the blood. Marketing circulates books into the hands of buyers, distributers, and other channels.

Marketing has a lot of pieces, and one that I worked with was building promotional web tools. Microsites, which are more simplistic and easy to navigate than a general website, are used to highlight giveaways or target specific buyer audiences.

design analysis

KissCon is a weekend-long romance event hosted by Avon and Harlequin, the romance novel imprints of HarperCollins Publishers. This conference features over 20 bestselling HC authors and hosts social gatherings for the fans. So, the website should have glamour, cheekiness, and a lot of sparkle!

The earlier KissCon site is dense with text and is visually inconsistent in color and centering.

On the left, a description of the event and ticket costs. Middle, a description of the event and its corporate sponsors with an author carousel. Right, a list of featured authors with an author carousel.

From a design perspective, the usability and modernity of the site could be improved.

mockup journal

I built two wireframe options for the client, the Avon Romance imprint. From the wireframe that they chose, I built any linked microsites.

This was the final wireframe that the Avon team chose. Based on this, I fleshed out the site.

prototype and release

As a final step, to demonstrate that the mockup was possible to implement, I developed my a stylized version of the wireframe for the final website.

Here is the final prototype of the website.

Once our team got clearance for this, we build the webiste using Beaver Builder, a software in Wordpress. You can view the updated KissCon site here.
